text.headline: Industrial Revolution to Today
text.text: Major events from the Industrial Revolution to the present day

text.headline: Industrial Revolution
text.text: The Industrial Revolution began in Great Britain and spread to other parts of the world, leading to major changes in manufacturing, transportation, and technology.

text.headline: American Revolution
text.text: The American Revolution resulted in the independence of the United States from Great Britain, establishing a new nation based on democratic principles.

text.headline: American Civil War
text.text: The American Civil War was fought between the Northern states (Union) and the Southern states (Confederacy), resulting in the abolition of slavery and the preservation of the Union.

text.headline: World War I
text.text: World War I, also known as the Great War, was a global conflict centered in Europe. It resulted in significant political, cultural, and social changes across the world.

text.headline: World War II
text.text: World War II was a global conflict that involved most of the world's nations. It resulted in major geopolitical changes and set the stage for the Cold War.

text.headline: Moon Landing
text.text: On July 20, 1969, NASA's Apollo 11 mission successfully landed humans on the Moon, with Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin taking the first steps on the lunar surface.

text.headline: Dissolution of the Soviet Union
text.text: The Soviet Union dissolved in 1991, marking the end of the Cold War and leading to the independence of its constituent republics.

text.headline: September 11 Attacks
text.text: On September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks were carried out in the United States, leading to significant global political and security changes.

text.headline: COVID-19 Pandemic
text.text: The COVID-19 pandemic affected the entire world, leading to significant health, economic, and social challenges. Vaccination efforts began in late 2020 and continue.
